result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Latoya A Knowlin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared by video for Latoya A Knowlin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense moves to challenge counts 1 and 2 due to lack of probable cause to show intent.
State gives argument.
BTC: Motion to dismiss counts 1 and 2 denied. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
